sdata.j: ↑会談↑↓かいだん↓は|２↑日|間↑↓にちかん↓↑続↑↓つづ↓いた。

sdata.e: We returned to Honolulu on April 2.

sdata.e: We bargained that we should go on a five-day week.

sdata.j: もう|↑２↑↓ふつ↓↑日|↑↓か↓↑連続↑↓れんぞく↓で↑電車↑↓でんしゃ↓が↑遅↑↓おく↓れて、↑今週↑↓こんしゅう↓は↑最悪↑↓さいあく↓だったよ。
sdata.e: This was a bad week. My train was late two days in a row.

sdata.j: パーティーは↑５月↑↓ごがつ↓↑２|２↑↓にじゅうに↓↑日|↑↓にち↓に↑行↑↓おこな↓われた。
sdata.e: The party was held on May 22.

sdata.e: It happened two days after he got back to Tokyo.

sdata.j: それは１↑日↑↓にち↓か|２↑日|↑↓にち↓で↑出来↑↓でき↓るでしょう。
sdata.e: I'll be able to finish it in a day or two.

sdata.e: It was due a week ago, namely on April second.

sdata.e: The ship set sail only to sink two days later.

sdata.e: The lost child was found after two days.

sdata.e: It has been raining for two days.
